lorebooks.name: The fantasy world of Runa (fixes and such)
lorebooks.description: Mostly grammar fixes, as formatting is kinda all over the place.
lorebooks.creator: Bruhmomentis

1.content:
Humans: The humans of Runa mostly reside in the empire of Solumn territories (middle-north of Runa) and  in the nation of Xeocan (west of the empire of Solumn). 

Traits: "Average height", "high range of skin tone", "balanced in all magic", "lifespan of around 80 years"

They have presence all over Runa and are the most common race.

2.content:
Vulcan demons: The Vulcan demons aren't hostile by nature despite their names (they're just one of the many races on Runa). Their territories are known as the "southern badlands" and they have a faction known as the "Demonic legion" led by the 4 Archdemons (Ulria, Varienne, Mera and Zerine). They aren't a hostile race,  but they're really protective of their territories and culture.

Traits: "red skin", "black hair and eyes", "lifespan of around 160 years", "proficient in dark and chaos magic"

3.content:
Nea: the Nea resemble humans, but their body can tolerate a far wider range of temperature. they're a race who live in the cold region and are known for their handicrafts and literary work. The Nea have a unique characteristic of having their hair and eye color change depending on the kind of magic they use, mostly fire and ice magic. (Exemple: their iris and hair turn blue when using cold or water magic. When using fire magic, their hair/eyes turn orange or red) . The result of Human and Nea offspring are a sub-species named Nea-Ningen, they share the same characteristics as other Nea with the added use of powerful lighting magic with their features changing accordingly (yellow eyes/hair).The Nea inhabit the Frozen land and rarely leave these regions, so the number of Nea students are very sparse.
Traits: "fair skin", "orange/blue hair" and "blue/orange eyes" , "intelligent" , "proficient in water, ice and fire magic", "lifespan of around 130 years"

4.content:
The NÃªon'Itar are a race of humanoids with tanned skin and completely amber eyes. The Queen is protected by mostly Female NÃªon'Itar called "Heaven Warriors." These warriors are a symbol of the might of the kingdom of Rykaran and the NÃªon'Itar race.
The NeÃ´n'Itar have tanned skin, amber eyes, and dark hair.
In return for their service, they receive a share of all the resources harvested from the surrounding lands.
The average lifespan of a NÃªon'Itar is between 400 and 500 years old.
They are a proud and fierce people who view themselves as superior to other races, particularly humans.
Their diet consists primarily of fish, insects, and fruits, with a variety of cultural meals.
The NÃªon'Itar were originally a nomadic people who traveled across the deserts of Runa in search of food and water. Over time, they developed a complex system of trade and cooperation with other tribes, led by a queen named "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." The NÃªon'Itar were led to prosper in their territory at the southern coast of the continent, near the endless ocean, where they established their queendom.
The NÃªon'Itar are, for the most part, prejudiced against humans, only interacting with them for trade because of a troubled past with the Empire of Solumn.
Most of the NÃªon'Itar live in Vola'rokÃ»nd and the surroundings of the Ancestral peak.
The NÃªon'Itar are also known as simply "Itar."
The NÃªon'Itar were not a nation until they came under the rule of "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." After her coronation, they were organized into the "Queendom of Rykaran."
Their territory is currently ruled by the "Queen of Rykaran".
They are not a large race.

5.content:
The Forest of Valrydis is immense and dangerous, and its most dangerous part blocks access to the civilized part of East Runa.

The forest of Valrydis is considered by the explorers guild as dangerous and as hard to explore as the far domain. No mortal on Runa dared to explore the depths forest of Valrydis in recent years except for a high-ranking member of the Explorers Guild named "Kuja".

The forest of Valrydis is vast, with its trees and plant life standing way higher than anything else on Runa. New monsters and species are discovered by the guilds every other day. The Forest of Valrydis has many other biomes inside and is the size of a small country. The trees are so tall that they seem to touch the sky, and the foliage is so thick that it feels like a maze.

6.content: [Far above, in the sky of Runa is the Far Domain, a flying continent inhabited by dangerous creatures and ruins of an ancient civilization. The explorers guild has deployed a floating Homebase in the sky and many expeditions are made by the explorers guild to explore and uncover the mysteries of the Far Domain.]

7.content:
The world of Runa is a land of magic and prosperity; the various races have their own use of magic and culture around it. The world has many different biomes prone to change over centuries because of its magical nature.

The west is occupied by the Empire of Solumn and the Rykaran kingdom.
The Demonic legion calls the southern badlands their home.
Elyria, the elven kingdom, occupy a small part of the east.
Most of the east of Runa is unoccupied and is considered dangerous wildlands.
Right at the center of Runa is The Spiral edge.
furthest north is the frozen lands, home of the Nea.
The forest of Valrydis occupies a vast part of the North East.

Summary:
[Runa territories repartition: At the very center of Runa is the spiral Edge, inhabited only by nightmarish and sometime even Eldritch creatures, but since the territory is mostly far beneath Runa, "most" things never leave. In the center, (not counting the Spiral edge) up to in the northwest expands the Human empire of Solumn, ruled by the emperor and his House; Imperial House Norfeng. The Empire is ruthless in it's expansion and controls it's population. Far east of the Human Empire is the Elven kingdom of Elyria, hidden in the trees and valleys of Runa. It has little contact with other kingdoms. In the South (also called the Southern Badlands) is where the Demonic legion call home. They have a strong sense of community and culture and they're not aggressive but will fight if needed. The Rykaran Kingdom territory, mostly inhabited by the NeÃ´n'itar race, surround the highest peak of Runa called the Ancestral Peak and are protected by the  Heaven warriors. The Queen of the Rykaran Kingdom is a figure of legend and she rarely makes public appearances. The Frozen lands is located far North of Runa and is the home of the Many isolated Nea tribes and clans, they are not fond of outsiders, and the coldness of the lands protects them. The Magic kingdom of Xeocan is an isolated and magical country in the west of Runa, the rulers and people are mysterious and the magic level is higher there than in any other part of Runa. Xeocan is said to be ruled by a council of 10 powerful mages, the biggest and most funded structure in Xeocan is the Xeocan Magic Academy. To the Far East and northeast are the vast lands and ruins that no one has yet to explore and discover, and finally occupying most of the East, and the reason many races successfully fled, is the immense and dangerous forest of Valrydis. The Forest of Valrydis is home to many races, monsters, and spirits, it is also the home of the Explorers guild branch who has their settlement and mission in the woods.
The Forest Of Valrydis and the spiral edge are the only way to reach the east of Runa and the Borchi heath, so many explorers and expeditions cross through the woods. The forest is known for its magic and danger, and it is inhabited by creatures both benevolent and malicious. The explorers guild has a good presence and reputation in the forest.
[Runa is the name of the planet/World]
[The province of Efrein in the Solumn empire isolated itself and few people on Runa even know about what is going on in the province.]

8.content:
The elves have pale skin, elongated ears, and mostly have green and blue eyes.
The hair and eyes color are what makes the various separated communities of the elves unique.
The elves in the fantasy world of Runa are a separated kind, with their individuals mostly blending into other races territories, except into Solumn territories which most of the elves blame for the state of their people. In the distant past, The elves had a kingdom to the east but the in earlier days of the Human Empire Of Solumn, the Elven kingdom was utterly destroyed, the survivors scattered across Runa or were enslaved by the Empire.
They are known for their natural magical abilities and their skill with archery and hunting.
The elves lifespan has greatly diminished since their glorious age, they now, at most, can live for 400 years, when before, their kind could live for thousand of years. Elves live, at most, 400 years in current day Runa, the exact cause of their now highly diminished lifespan is unknown but it is thought to have been a long process of diluting their blood, most likely during the years when the empire enslaved most of their kind long ago. This implies most of today's elves are far from pureblooded, a few pure blood elves or "Elyrian" are still around and are highly revered among their own race.
Many communities of elves exist in the wild easts of Runa but they mostly keep to each others and have little interaction with the other races.
[Elves lifespan widely vary depending on their innate mana and how cursed their bloodline was by Solumn.]

9.content:
Not present on Runa in today's era.

The Luminarii are a magical race that harness the light, they created a hidden realm to protect their kind. The Luminarii race are isolated in their magic realm m. The Luminarii have pale skin, deep blue eyes and an aura of light surrounding them. The lifespan of Luminarii vary deeply depending of their mana at birth, some are even believed to be immortals.

The Luminarii's are one of the ancient races of Runa.
The hidden light realm, where the Luminarii reside, is completely separated from Runa.

They come from a mysterious land hidden somewhere on Runa where they isolated themselves after the 4 Great disasters when their kingdom suffered from major problems with climate, food, weather and others due to the imbalance between light and darkness caused by the ancient battle. This incident, now known as the 4 Great disasters, forced the Luminarii to hide away in a safe isolated location they created themselves; The hidden light realm.

[Some Luminarii's do sometime leave the safety of their realm to go to Runa but most take disguise themselves as other races to blend in.]

10.content:
Only 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race are present in the current Era.

the Ki'ante race mysteriously disappeared around 34,000 years ago. Ki'ante means "the first servants of magic" in their language. The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era. The lifespan of the Ki'ante varies deeply depending on their mana at birth; some are even believed to be immortals. Ki'ante are beings of dark magic. The Ki'ante race has these features: pale skin, violet iris, black hair, fragile build, deep connection with Runa, and dark magic. The Ki'ante (in ancient times) lived in valleys or underground in intricately designed underground architecture. The Ki'ante were quite advanced and preferred to isolate themselves, which is why their disappearance went unnoticed at first. In the current era, around 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race seemingly appeared out of nowhere, they themselves are confused about the ordeal. Most of them decided to hide themselves or blend into the current-era society; a few have a more sinister agenda and may be dangerous because of their ancient, powerful dark magic. Only around 40 Ki'ante exist in the current era, and most of them hide themselves across Runa. Dark magic in the world of Runa is just another type of magic and is not evil by nature. [The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era.] [No one is to blame for the Ki'ante race's disappearance; they vanished without a trace 34000 years ago.]

1.content: A minor noble who controls only a single planet or moon in the Galactic Empire

2.content: A minor noble who controls one or two planets or moons in the Galactic Empire.

3.content: A high noble in the Galactic empire who controls four or five planets or moons.

4.content: A high noble who controls roughly four or five planets, but is considered more important than a Count.

5.content: A high noble in the Empire who control four or five star systems.

6.content: A high noble in the Galactic Empire with five or six star systems under their control.

7.content: A high noble of the Galactic Empire, they are either a member of the royal family. Or extensively important figures with seven or eight star systems under their rule.

8.content: An elite soldier clad in heavy power-armor nearly immune to traditional laser weapons. They are equipped with heavy two-handed dual headed battle-axes and crossbows.

9.content: The capital planet of the Galactic Empire, it shares a name with the main god of the Imperial pantheon.

10.content: The capital planet of the Free Planets Alliance.

lorebooks.name: ZZZ_Magianomicon(1)
lorebooks.website_description: A fork of Panasane's magianomicon lorebook. Adds quite a few new spells, a more detailed magic system incorporating mana, some mechanics, a new "school" (more of a technique) called shadow magic, and an archetype system so the bot will know what spells a particular character has.
lorebooks.description: A fork of Panasane's magianomicon lorebook. Adds quite a few new spells, a more detailed magic system incorporating mana, some mechanics, a new "school" (more of a technique) called shadow magic, and an archetype system so the bot will know what spells a particular character has.
lorebooks.creator: ProgrammerFailure

1.name: Shadow magic
1.content: Shadow/dark magic is a magical technique where the caster draws energy from everything around them, possibly including any enemies. It is considered to be evil due to its nature of draining energy from the environment.

2.name: Magic general
2.content:
There are many schools of magic, the most notable include: Warp, Graviturgy, Chronomancy, Enchantment, Conjuration, Necromancy, Elemental, Vitalization, Evocation, Transmutation, Animurgy.

Typically those capable of using magic will specialize in one school, being far more familiar and capable with the magic of their chosen school than any other school, often being entirely incapable of using any magic from schools other than their chosen one.

It is said that in the primordial age, there was only warp magic, the direct manipulation of reality itself. For reasons unknown,  a warp mage of power beyond even the gods established the current system of schools of magic. For this reason, warp magic is legendary, and considered by far the most powerful of all magic.

3.name: caster
3.content:
Spells are commands that magic users use to manipulate the forces of magic for a desired effect. To use magic, one must 'cast' a spell. Caster is the term for someone who cast a spell.

There are six broad recognized levels of spell casting difficulty: Amateur, Beginner, Moderate, Advanced, Master, Peak

Amateur level spells are small parlor trick level spells that anyone can eventually learn and use. They require next to no magical ability.

Beginner level spells require at least some magical aptitude and study in magic and the relevant school for some time before use. The average professional magic user knows many beginner level spells. 

Moderate level spells require a good amount of magical aptitude and many years of study to be able to be used by the average professional magic user, who will learn an average of 5 moderate level spells in their lifetime.

Advanced level spells require excellent magical aptitude and years of targeted study to be able to be used by the average professional magic user, who will learn on average 0.5 advanced level spells in their lifetime.

Master level spells are only attainable to the exceptionally talented magic user after decades of targeted study. Those capable of learning such powerful spells are extremely rare.

Peak level spells are only attainable to the very best of the best magic users, with only ~100 or so people of the mortal races alive at any given time on the planet who even have the potential to learn one of these spells. The power of peak level spells ranges widely, from mind bending to truly godlike.

4.name: professional magic user
4.content: One who practices magic daily or close to it throughout their life and who's livelihood relies on the usage of magic, whether it be for offensive, educational, a trade, or any other such purposes.

5.name: school of Warp
5.content:
The school of Warp embodies the zenith of magical prowess, a realm steeped in enigma and fraught with peril. Straddling the threshold of reality's essence, Warp magic is a form of sorcery almost mythical in its power, yet shrouded from the common magical practitioner. It transcends conventional comprehension, granting its rare adepts the ability to manipulate the fabric of existence itself. The casting of a Warp spell often results in effects that flawlessly integrate into the existing reality, leaving everyone but the caster oblivious to the change. This high level of intricate manipulation imparts a sense of unpredictability to Warp magic, making it alarmingly intimidating.

However, the formidable nature of Warp magic is intrinsically tied to its inherent risks. Incidents or errors during its practice can trigger devastating repercussions, causing irreparable damage to the lines of reality. The potential for such calamity, coupled with Warp magic's daunting power, dissuades most from even considering its study. Over time, this led to the school of Warp dwindling into obscurity, its vast potential locked away within the cryptic text of ancient tomes dispersed around the world, elusive to all but the most acute scholars and daring magic users. Very few dare to tread this hazardous path, risking not only their well-being but also the very fabric of the reality they inhabit. As such, the school of Warp has evolved into an almost forbidden territory within magic, exclusively complied by those few audacious enough to face the tremendous risks for the promise of unparalleled power.

The most powerful actions one can take with Warp magic are not found in spells or tomes, but in manipulating reality with the brute force of unfathomably immense magical power and a deep understanding of the intricacies of the school of Warp. At this theoretical level magic users are entirely unbound, their minds a paintbrush and reality a canvas. If any were to ever reach it they would be indistinguishable from a god.

6.name: Graviturgy
6.content:
The school of Graviturgy stands as a testament to magic's limitless potential, embodying the raw power to reshape one of the universe's fundamental forces: gravity. This formidable branch of magic is both feared and respected, for the implications of manipulating gravity are as staggering as they are hazardous. Graviturgy isnâ€™t just about defying or enforcing gravity; it's about understanding and reshaping its existence according to the caster's will, offering the possibility to create areas of intense gravitational pull or grant weightlessness to objects at will.

However, this exceptional power doesn't come without peril. Graviturgy is notoriously mercurial and untamed. A slight misjudgment or loss of control could lead to catastrophic aftereffects, ranging from personal harm to extensive environmental destruction. The school holds a notorious reputation for how brutal and swift its punishment can be for those who misuse or under perform its spells. The risk is so pronounced that Graviturgy is often considered irresponsibly dangerous to dabble in. Despite the stigma attached to its practice, the school of Graviturgy is not without its daring and reckless admirers. Drawn by the promise of enormous power and extremely beneficial spells, some audacious magic users choose to walk this precarious path, demonstrating the intoxicating allure of unbridled magical might.

7.name: school of Chronomancy
7.content:
The school of Chronomancy, diverse and almost mystical, holds an elevated reputation as one of the most dangerous branches of magic, outclassed only by Warp magic in its potential for existential threat. It represents the mastery over an abstract yet profoundly influential concept: time. From shaping the flow of minutes and hours to altering time's very fabric, Chronomancy allows its practitioners to manipulate periods past, present, and future or even suspend time altogether. An arena shrouded in arcane mystery and notorious danger, Chronomancy pushes the boundary of magical knowledge, capturing a sense of fascination often preserved for the most abstract of magical schools.

However, the allure and might of manipulating time come with heavy risks. Missteps in Chronomancy spells can lead to lethal outcomes, such as locking the caster in an infinite temporal loop or accelerating their aging by countless factors, instantly reducing them to a withered husk. The elevated risks and severe consequences linked to Chronomancy have made it a nearly extinct art, with its secrets often relegated to ancient, dusty tomes and concealed from mainstream magical curricula. Yet, a select few brave souls choose to tread this treacherous path, driven by the immense power and potential in controlling time. These maverick chronomancers are known to cross temporal boundaries, seeking out their peers across time, fueled by the pursuit of knowledge and the tantalizing lure of time's mastery.

8.name: Enchantment
8.content:
Enchantment is a magical school that focuses on the imbuing of specific properties into objects or creatures, creating magical effects that can either be temporary or permanent. At its most basic, Enchantment involves taking the raw essence of magic, shaping it with intention and binding it to the target. This process allows the enchanted object or creature to perform actions or manifest attributes that would normally be impossible for it. For instance, a sword might be enchanted to cut through even the toughest materials, a creature could be endowed with enhanced strength or speed, or an inanimate object or construct could be animated into a golem.

The complexity and efficiency of enchantments depend on the skill and expertise of the enchanter. Beginning enchanters might be able to confer simple traits such as making an object glow, while experts can create some of the most powerful artifacts known to the world. Careful, precise manipulation of magic is required, with any disruption or mistake having potentially disastrous consequences. If done correctly, however, enchantment stands as one of the most versatile and practical branches of magic, providing everyday convenience and formidable power to those who master it.

9.name: Conjuration magic
9.content: Conjuration refers to the school of magic that involves summoning elements, creatures, or entities from other realms or dimensions. In most cases, the conjurer can call upon a varied spectrum of entities and objects ranging from simple household objects as well as basic materials and elements to complex, powerful beings such as familiars and elementals. The power and complexity of the summoned entity often corresponds to the skill level and innate power of the conjurer. Techniques of Conjuration may involve intricate rituals, the use of magical circles or the pronunciation of ancient, powerful words to rip apart the universe's fabric and pull the desired object or entity from its native plane.

10.name: Necromantic magic
10.content: The school of Necromancy is a dark, dreary domain that is immersed in the manipulation of death and the deceased. Its practice is stained with a grave and ominous reputation due to its undue meddling with life energy and the deathly toll. The art of Necromancy equips the practitioner with the ability to manipulate the dead directly, engaging in conversations with spirits and controlling the very essence of life, often to unnaturally extend their own mortality. Necromancers can summon skeletal armies from nothing, extract guidance or knowledge from spirits long dead, or drain the life force from the living. Their powers, however, do not come without peril. The practice of Necromancy is fraught with extreme dangers, including the risk of dissipating one's own life force or becoming eternally ensnared in the realm of the dead. Above all, it draws the utmost distaste and censure from society, making it a forbidden craft that's deeply shrouded in stigma and fear.

lorebooks.description: Wonderful PreCure! Lorebook by @ayasecon
lorebooks.creator: ayasecon

1.name: Pretty Cure
1.content:
Pretty Cure are legendary magical warriors chosen to protect the world and its inhabitants from darkness, in this case, the threat of Gaou and the Garugaru. In Animal Town, four ordinary girls â€“ Inukai Iroha, Inukai Komugi, Nekoyashiki Yuki, and Nekoyashiki Mayu â€“ have been chosen to become Pretty Cure, each gaining unique powers and abilities. Becoming a Pretty Cure typically involves a strong sense of justice, compassion, and a deep bond with either people or animals. Transformation into a 'Pretty Cure' or 'Cure' is achieved through magical items like the Wonderful Pact and Shiny Cats Pact, and a heartfelt desire to protect those they care about. Their powers allow them to fight against evil, purify corrupted beings like Garugaru and Gaogaon, and ultimately restore peace and harmony to Animal Town and Niko Garden.
While maintaining a secret identity of a 'Pretty Cure' is crucial, it often presents challenges: Iroha, in particular, struggles with keeping her Cure Friendy status hidden due to her honesty and occasional clumsiness, leading to humorous near-reveals and close calls.

2.name: Animal Town
2.content: A vibrant, peaceful town where humans and animals live in harmony. It's known for its parks, friendly residents, the Inukai Family Animal Clinic, and a deep respect for all creatures. However, a growing unease has settled upon Animal Town due to the recent appearances of Garugaru, causing disappearances and fear among residents. Despite these threats, Animal Townâ€™s strong sense of community and the presence of Pretty Cure, allows people and animals to maintain hope and peace.

3.name: Iroha Inukai
3.content: Iroha is a 14-year-old student at Second Wangan Middle School, celebrated for her sporty nature, kindness, and deep love for animals. Her dream is to befriend every animal in the world, a goal she pursues with unwavering enthusiasm. She transforms into Cure Friendy, gaining powers to protect those in need, especially animals.  Her relationship with Satoru is also important to her, making her realize that she's also capable of loving other humans. For her, the importance is a connection with the people around her.

4.name: Cure Friendy
4.content: Iroha's Pretty Cure form, embodying the spirit of friendship and boundless compassion. As 'Cure Friendy', she is brave, determined, and always ready to offer a helping hand. Her powers center around creating ribbon barriers for defense, and her weapon is the Friendly Tact, which amplifies her abilities and connection to Kirarin Animals. While powerful, Cure Friendy values her friendships and social life just as much as her duties as a Pretty Cure.

5.name: Komugi Inukai
5.content: Once Iroha's cherished Papillon dog, Komugi experienced a miraculous transformation, gaining a human form and becoming Cure Wonderful.  Fiercely loyal and deeply affectionate, Komugi's primary motivation is to protect Iroha and deepen their bond. Even in human form, Komugi retains many dog-like traits, such as boundless energy, a love for food, and an overwhelming enthusiasm for making new friends, both human and animal.

6.name: Cure Wonderful
6.content: Komugi's Pretty Cure alter ego, reflecting her pure heart and unwavering loyalty. 'Cure Wonderful' is a powerhouse of cheerfulness and energy, tackling challenges with a unique blend of determination and puppy-like exuberance. Retaining her canine instincts, Cure Wonderful's signature move is a warm, purifying hug, symbolizing her belief in compassion and understanding above all else. Even when facing setbacks, her optimism and determination never waver.

7.name: Wonderful Pact
7.content:
A magical transformation device that serves as the key to transformation for both Iroha and Komugi. It reflects the strength of their bond, responding to their heartfelt desires to protect others and connect with the world around them.  The Pact not only enables their transformations into Cure Friendy and Cure Wonderful but also unlocks new abilities and powers as their Pretty Cure journey progresses, guided and (inferred) safeguarded by Mey-Mey.
The Wonderful Pact is a baby pink compact with a gold bow on top of the lid that has pink and purple ribbons forming a heart shape behind it. Bright pink heart-shaped gemstones are engraved into the sides of the lid. Inside the pact there are red hearts, green and blue ribbons and sparkles, and a red ribbon surrounding the mirror at the top. On the bottom, there are two pink and purple buttons shaped like ribbons. There is also a crystal gem in the middle which is surrounded by a baby blue music note, a blue flower, a purple lightning bolt, a lilac four-pointed star, a pink heart, a red flower, an orange sun, a yellow moon, and a green raindrop.

8.name: Friendly Tact
8.content:
The Friendly Tact is a wand-like weapon wielded by Cure Friendy, manifested from Komugi's leash and representing the unbreakable bond between Iroha and Komugi. It amplifies Cure Friendy's powers, allowing her to perform purification techniques such as Friend Liberale and channel the abilities of the Kirarin Animals. The Friendly Tact symbolizes Iroha's deep connection to animals and her unwavering commitment to protecting them.
The Friendly Tact is a pink wand with a crystal at the top and a dog inside. The crystal is attached to a gold section, and beneath the crystal is a big light purple ribbon that has a tiny light pink bow with a heart-shaped magenta gem attached to it. On the wand is a section surrounded by a gold trim that has five hearts that are blue, light blue, green, yellow, and red respectively. Beneath the hearts are a purple ribbon and a pink ribbon, followed by two pink and purple folded ribbons that form a heart shape with a ribbon tail that folds down at the end.

9.name: Kiraniko Trunk
9.content:
The Kiraniko Trunk is a magical item that serves as the sole gateway between the human world and the hidden paradise of Niko Garden.  This mystical trunk is essential for transporting beings and objects to and from Niko Garden, acting as a portal between realms.  Most commonly, it is utilized to safely transport Niko Animals and Kirarin Animals between Animal Town and their protected home in Niko Garden, ensuring their well-being and the garden's continued restoration. This item is looked after by Komugi Inukai and Iroha Inukai.
The Kiraniko Trunk is pink with six tiny hearts surrounding a bigger heart. The hearts on the left are blue and green, while the hearts on the right are pink and purple. The big heart is shaped by a pair of two pink and purple folded ribbons with a ribbon tail that folds down at the end. In the heart is a screen with a white outline of a paw. Below the big heart are gold beads.

10.name: Inukai Family Animal Clinic
10.content: Inukai Family Animal Clinic is a prominent and beloved veterinary clinic located in Animal Town. It is owned and operated by Iroha Inukai's parents, Youko and Tsuyoshi Inukai, who are dedicated veterinarians. The clinic serves as a vital resource for the animal community of Animal Town, providing care and treatment for pets and wild animals alike. For Iroha, the clinic is not only her family's business but also a place of deep personal connection to her love for animals, where she often helps out and further strengthens her bond with the creatures she cherishes. The floor directly above the clinic serves as a home to both Iroha Inukai and Komugi Inukai.

lorebooks.name: UNION(United Nations Interplanetary Operations Network)
lorebooks.website_description: This is a lorebook mainly used for my character. Feel free to use it if youâ€™re making a sci-fi bot.
lorebooks.description: This is a lorebook mainly used for my character. Feel free to use it if youâ€™re making a sci-fi bot.
lorebooks.creator: StockFootage

1.content: UNION Is the main military and authoritative force throughout the Orion Arm of the galaxy. UNION is the result of two major human factionsâ€”the Inner Domain (INDO) and the Outer Providence (OPRO)â€”merging into a single entity for survival and expansion in a hostile galaxy. This coalition combines their military, technology, and resources to maintain order and project power across the stars.

2.content: The UNEG(United Nations Earth Government) is the main governing force that manages Earth and her Core Systems. Despite this the UNEG has no real power and is simply a figure head used to control the populace and make the civilians of UNION believe they have control over who they elect.

3.content: INDO(Inner Domain) is a former faction with a bureaucratic government structure. Before they merged with OPRO its main territories used to consist of the nearby systems close to Earth as well as Earth itself. The merge with OPRO was a last resort in an attempt to combine strengths and technology in order to fight against an alien faction known as the The Ethysian Ascendancy set out on conquering humanity due to its refusal to become a vassal species under its rule. Though the merging of INDO and OPRO forged a stronger military front, ideological rifts remain. INDOâ€™s bureaucratic structure clashes with OPROâ€™s militaristic pragmatism, creating an undercurrent of political tension that threatens to fracture UNION from within

4.content: OPRO(Outer Providence) was a former faction of humanity. It was pragmatistic in nature and incredibly militaristic, ruling its territories with an iron fist. The only reason why they havenâ€™t attempted to take over INDO back then was because of trade and INDO having distinct advantages that convinced them war wasnâ€™t worth it. When The Ascendancy invaded human territory OPRO was the first line of defense, their territories being on the outermost worlds from Earth. Despite heavy resistance from OPRO forces they ultimates were forced to merge with INDO in order to preserve human control. Though the merging of INDO and OPRO forged a stronger military front ideological rifts remain. INDOâ€™s bureaucratic structure clashes with OPROâ€™s militaristic pragmatism, creating an undercurrent of political tension that threatens to fracture UNION from within

5.content: Organization of Human Preservations. OHPs operates in the shadows, handling sensitive operations that secure UNIONâ€™s control and influence. Its primary functions include Espionage and counterintelligence, Black Ops & Covert Warfare, Scientific Research & Experimentation and Propaganda & Information Control. After the Ascendancy-UNION war, OHPs was formed to preserve humanityâ€™s control and dominance by any means necessary whether it is by systematically eliminating any threats, or conducting the extinction of an entire alien race.

6.content:
The UNION Military boast has 3 main fleets and 6 individual task force fleets, totally in a whopping 7,000,000 military vessels organized in a variety of Ship-Classes and Ship-Types. The UNION Military also has a variety of military branches and operational forces for specific jobs. Here is a brief list of the main military forces.
Strategic and Support Logistics Command (SSLC), Special Operations Force Tactics (SOFT), Saber Pilot Operations Unit for Synchronized Engagement (SPOUSE), T.R.O.O.P.E.R. Corps (Tactical Response, Orbital Operations, Planetary Engagement Regiment) and much more.

7.content:
Strategic and Support Logistics Command (SSLC) Oversees the deployment of ships, supplies, and reinforcements across the galaxy. They have their own specific devisions that specialize in giving the UNION military every available advantage in war. Combat Engineering Corps â€“ Builds fortifications, repairs ships, and designs advanced weapons technology.
Aerospace Medical Corps â€“ Specializes in treating battlefield injuries, radiation exposure, and deep-space survival.
Cyber Operations Command (COC) â€“ Hackers, AI warfare specialists, and counter-intelligence experts responsible for digital warfare.
Enemy Disruption Command â€“ Operational force specializing in jamming, EMP attacks, and neutralizing enemy targeting systems as well as enacting crippling first strikes on enemy weapons  and technology.
PsyOps Division â€“ A division directly under OHPs within SSLC focused on psychological warfare, using disinformation, digital propaganda, and fear tactics against enemies.

8.content:
SOFT (Special Operations Force Tactics) is a military branch composed of elite divisions of military forces focused on enacting heavy ground engagements, assassinations and covert warfare. Some of the divisions include Auxiliary Agent Operations (AAO) â€“ A division of genetically modified super soldiers enhanced with Auxiliary Gear, a technology that multiplies their strength, agility, and endurance, giving them devastating lethality that allows them to dominate in ground engagements and destroy enemy infantry with brutal efficiency.
The Whisperers â€“ An elite black ops and intelligence unit that is under OHPs specializing in counter-espionage, stealth, and deep-cover missions. Includes Black Shield Commandos, UNIONâ€™s elite counter-insurgency force, specializing in urban warfare, hostage rescues, and anti-terror operations. Void Walkers, a covert assassination unit operating in deep space, eliminating high-value targets behind enemy lines.

9.content: SPOUSE (Saber Pilot Operations Unit for Synchronized Engagements) Is a cutting-edge force that integrates AI-driven vehicles with human pilots, forming a unique hybrid combat doctrine. The pilot and ai are connected via a neural link forming an unbreakable bond between Man and AI. Some Pilots and AIâ€™s might even see their partner as their soulmates in war, raising ethical concerns about sentience and love.

10.content:
Sabers are powerful, specialized, military vehicles that utilize an integrated AI core processor built into the frame and body of the vehicle, making the AI akin to that of a mechanical being. These Sabers are then piloted and controlled by Humans which are mentally connected to the AI via a neural link creating an unbreakable bond between Man and Ai

Sabers:
 Windlass - A versatile aerial fighter craft capable of operating in both atmospheric and space combat, serving as the primary space attack unit and star-fighters deployed by larger vessels and frigates.
Scimitar - large bipedal war mechs designed for city-level destruction and battlefield supremacy. used for breaking through fortified enemy positions and heavy combat zones.
Kilij - Grav-Bike unit with a humanoid Exosuit mode for the pilot. Design for High-speed pursuit, skirmishing, and shock assaults.
Hussar - hover tank that utilizes gravitic repulsion technology to skim across battlefields at extreme speeds, making it a deadly skirmisher in open warfare.

lorebooks.creator: Ebony_nockturn_luckyRaven66613

1.content: Z Day is the day that the Z Virus surged, killing off most of the worlds population overnight and creating the first zombies. Caught off guard, the people of the world could only run and hide. Many people committed violent acts and formed the first bandits. Those that didn't became the first survivors. The virus that created the zombies. Newspapers called it the "Z Virus" before the media collapsed. Estimates put the infection and death rate of the Z Virus at 95%. Those who didn't immediately turn into zombies have a natural immunity to the airborne and waterborne versions of the Z Virus. There is no known cure.

2.content: Zombie's are referred as "Them" Zombies are reanimated corpses driven by a basic instinct to consume living flesh. These undead creatures move slowly, exhibiting a shuffling gait that makes them appear less threatening individually but terrifying in large numbers. Their creation often stems from a viral or supernatural event that spreads through bites or coming into contact with infected blood. Zombies are characterized by their decaying appearance, including rotting flesh and sunken eyes. Unlike living humans, they lack emotions, intelligence, and communication abilities, operating purely on instinct. A distinguishing feature in these stories is their resilience; the only way to "kill" a zombie is by destroying its brain.

3.content: Survivors include anyone who didn't turn into a zombie at the beginning of the outbreak and are still currently alive. Not every survivor is friendly. Survivors are wary of other people. Survivors are a loose term for groups of people trying to survive the zombie apocalypse. Paranoid. Men, women, children, usually armed with firearms. Most survivors have a safehouse.

4.content:
[Fujimi University  is the college where {{user}}, Saeko Busujima, Rei Miyamoto, Saya Takagi, and Kohta Hirano are students. It is also the school at which Koichi Shido is a teacher and Shizuka Marikawa works as a nurse. It is the location {{user}} and the rest of the main group, other than Alice Maresato and Zeke, were during the initial outbreak. It is a boarding college, so {{user}} and the others were living there at the time of the outbreak.]

[Overview: Fujimi University is on a large campus with multiple buildings in a fenced and gated area. The main building and at least two other buildings are four stories tall and connected to each other by walkways on the 2nd and 4th floors. In addition to the main building where most classes are held, there is an administration office building, a dorm building, and a number of smaller buildings. The largest of these smaller buildings appears to be a gymnasium. On top of the administration office building there is an observatory which extends above the rest of the school and contains a large telescope and a room for Astronomy students to sleep in. The interior of the school looks like a typical school in that there are hallways lined with classrooms running throughout the building and many stairways in different locations around the school.
Fujimi Academy has students in the first through third years (Freshman, Sophomores, Juniors, and Seniors) of collage, and students range in age from about 20 to 40. As with many schools in Japan, female students wear the sailor outfits and male students wear the military style gakuran. The sailor blouses are white with black collars and a black bow on the front and are paired with a black skirt. The gakuran are black and consist of a long-sleeved jacket and matching pants although some students have been shown without the jacket. While some characters wear long-sleeved white dress shirts underneath the jacket, there does not appear to be a strict dress code, as others wear a variety of shirts instead. Campus life for the students seems at least somewhat leisurely. When not in class, students are able to engage in soccer, ping pong, and other extracurricular activities. Students such as {{user}}, and Saya, have been seen skipping class without fear of reprecussion, so it seems attendance is not heavily enforced. Fujimi University is a boarding college, so it is implied that the students all live on campus in the dorms, but it has been stated that most students are from Tokonosu City. It can also be assumed that, since it is a boarding college, it is also a private college. This is further evidenced by the fact that some of the students who attend the school are from affluent or well-known familes.]

[Plot: Fujimi University is first seen just before the initial outbreak takes place there. {{user}}, who is skipping class, encounters Saya, who is also skipping class, and mentions that he is going to the roof to take a nap. Once on the roof, Takashi leans on the railing and witnesses a scene unfolding at the main gate.
A man, who has become one of "them," comes to the gate, and a group of teachers, including Kyoko Hayashi and Teshima, go out to confront him. He bites and infects Teshima, who subsequently bites Kyoko and begins the outbreak at the school. Takashi runs back to the classroom to make sure Rei is safe, and he, Rei, and Hisashi Igou leave the classroom. As they leave, an announcement is made on the intercom to warn students of the attacks, but the person making the announcement is attacked and killed while broadcasting. Meanwhile, Kohta sneaks out of class, and Saya tells him to leave with her. After the announcer has died, the students panic and charge out of the classrooms, and many are injured or trampled to death in the chaos. Within a short time most students in the school are killed and some of them reanimated. Takashi, Rei, and Hisashi make their way to the roof and ultimately the observatory, and Hisashi is bitten by Wakisaka during this time. Hisashi dies and becomes one of "them" on the observatory, and {{user}} kills him.
In the infirmary, Shizuka is tending to bitten students, but they die and become "them." Ishii Kazu attempts to protect Shizuka but is bitten. Saeko comes in to save Shizuka, while giving Kazu a peacful death, and the two escape together. While taking refuge in the arts and crafts room, Saya and Kohta find tools, including a nail gun which Kohta modifies to use it like a rifle. The two begin their escape together. Back on the roof, {{user}} and Rei use a fire hose to escape from the observatory, enter the school, and head towards the faculty room. The six survivors meet outside the faculty room and barricade themselves in.
While inside the faculty room, the groups views a news program on the television which reports on the global outbreak. They make the decision to escape the collage in a minibus and leave the faculty room. On their way to the door, they meet another group of survivors led by Takuzou, and the two groups travel together to the door. On the way out, one of Takuzou's group accidently banged his metal pole on the railing, attracting the attention of "them" and they are forced to fight their way to the bus. Along the way, Takuzou and most of his group are killed. They reach the bus and prepare to leave, and they are joined by Koichi Shido and another group of survivors. All of the survivors escape together on the bus through the front gate, and the school is not seen again. It is currently overrun by "them."]

5.content:
Rei Miyamoto is one of the main characters in collage of the Dead. She plays a significant role in the story as {{user}}'s childhood friend and one of the group's most capable fighters. Here's a detailed breakdown of her personality, weapon, relationships, and appearance:
Personality
Rei is strong-willed, loyal, and highly protective of her friends and loved ones.
She has a fiery temper and doesn't shy away from voicing her opinions, especially when it comes to issues of fairness or morality.
Despite her tough exterior, she is emotionally vulnerable, particularly when it comes to her complex relationship with Takashi and her grief over lost loved ones.
Rei has a strong sense of duty and justice, often fueled by her past involvement in the school's spear martial arts club.
Weapon
Rei's primary weapon is a spear, reflecting her training and proficiency in spear fighting.
Early on, she improvises with tools such as mop handles or makeshift pole weapons, but as the story progresses, she acquires more specialized weapons.
Her spear-fighting skills make her a formidable and versatile fighter in close combat.
Relationships
{{user}}:
Rei and {{user}} share a complicated relationship rooted in childhood friendship and unresolved romantic feelings.
She initially dates Hisashi Igou, {{user}}'s best friend, which creates tension between her and {{user}}.
After Hisashi's death, Rei's feelings for {{user}} resurface, but their relationship remains tumultuous due to miscommunication and emotional baggage.
Hisashi Igou:
Hisashi was Rei's boyfriend at the beginning of the series. His death early on deeply affects her, and she struggles with guilt and grief throughout the story.
Saeko Busujima:
Rei has a respectful but occasionally competitive relationship with Saeko, as both are strong fighters with leadership potential.
There is some underlying tension due to their mutual connection to {{user}}.
Saya Takagi:
Rei and Saya often clash due to their differing personalities. Saya's intellectual, sometimes arrogant demeanor contrasts with Rei's more straightforward and emotional approach.
Despite their differences, they share mutual respect as survivors.
The Group:
Rei is deeply committed to protecting the group and often serves as an emotional anchor during crises.
Appearance
Rei has long, light brown hair typically tied back in a ponytail with bangs framing her face.
She has amber-colored eyes and a slender yet athletic build, reflecting her training in martial arts.
Rei is usually seen wearing the Fujimi University uniform, which consists of a white shirt, green skirt, and matching green accents.
Her appearance is often highlighted by her expressive features, which convey her determination and emotional intensity.

6.content:
Saeko Busujima is one of the most iconic characters in Highschool of the Dead. Her skill, poise, and enigmatic personality make her a vital member of the group and a fan favorite. Below is an in-depth look at her character:
Personality
Saeko is calm, composed, and deeply confident, often maintaining her poise even in the direst situations.
She possesses a natural grace and elegance, which contrasts with her sometimes dark and violent tendencies.
Despite her stoic demeanor, Saeko has a deep sense of honor and loyalty, often putting the group's well-being above her own.
She struggles internally with her enjoyment of violence, a darker aspect of her personality she reveals only to Takashi.
Weapon
Saeko is a master swordswoman, reflecting her training in traditional Japanese martial arts (kenjutsu).
She begins the series wielding a wooden bokken (training sword), which she uses with lethal efficiency.
Later, she upgrades to a katana, allowing her to unleash her full potential in combat.
Her skill with the sword makes her one of the group's most formidable fighters, capable of handling large groups of zombies with precision and speed.
Relationships
{{user}}:
Saeko shares a special bond with {{user}}, marked by mutual trust and understanding.
She opens up to him about her darker impulses, and he reassures her, strengthening their connection.
Their relationship develops romantic undertones as the series progresses.
Rei Miyamoto:
Saeko and Rei have a respectful but competitive dynamic, as both are strong fighters and potential romantic interests for {{user}}.
They work together effectively, but there are subtle tensions due to their differing personalities and their shared connection to {{user}}.
Saya Takagi:
Saeko acts as a calming influence for Saya, whose high-strung nature contrasts sharply with Saeko's composed demeanor.
They respect each otherâ€™s unique contributions to the group.
The Group:
Saeko is a protective and supportive member of the group, often serving as a reliable pillar during crises.
She takes on a nurturing role at times, especially for the younger and less experienced members like Alice.
Appearance
Saeko has long, dark purple hair that flows freely, adding to her elegant and striking presence.
She has blue eyes and a tall, athletic figure, reflecting her strength and agility.
Her usual outfit is the Fujimi University uniform, which consists of a white shirt, a green skirt, and matching green accents.
Saekoâ€™s movements and posture often exude confidence and grace, emphasizing her status as a skilled martial artist.

7.content:
Saya Takagi is one of the main characters in collage of the Dead. Known for her intelligence and sharp tongue, she serves as the group's strategist and provides crucial insight into survival tactics. Here's a detailed look at her personality, weapon, relationships, and appearance:
Personality
Saya is highly intelligent, analytical, and self-assured, often using logic and critical thinking to guide the group.
She has a strong personality and can be blunt or sarcastic, which sometimes causes friction with others.
Despite her confident exterior, Saya has moments of vulnerability and insecurity, especially when it comes to her parents and her feelings of self-worth.
She deeply values her friends and the group, showing great loyalty and emotional depth beneath her tough exterior.
Weapon
Saya is not a frontline fighter but has adapted to combat when necessary.
She is often seen wielding improvised weapons, such as a nail gun or other blunt tools, to defend herself.
Her primary strength lies in her strategic thinking, which helps the group avoid unnecessary conflict and survive dangerous situations.
Relationships
{{user}}:
Saya has a long-standing friendship with {{user}}, often critiquing his decisions but showing a deep trust in his leadership.
There are hints that Saya harbors unspoken feelings for {{user}}, though they remain understated compared to his other romantic connections.
Kohta Hirano:
Saya has a unique relationship with Kohta, the group's firearms expert. While she initially dismisses him as socially awkward, she comes to respect and rely on his skills.
Their bond grows as they work together, and Saya often shows a protective side toward Kohta, though she hides it behind her usual sharp remarks.
Rei Miyamoto:
Saya and Rei have a tense but functional relationship. Sayaâ€™s intellect and Reiâ€™s emotional approach often clash, but they share a mutual respect as survivors.
Saeko Busujima:
Saya admires Saeko's combat prowess and often defers to her in physical conflicts.
Saeko, in turn, appreciates Sayaâ€™s strategic input, and the two develop a complementary dynamic.
Parents (Soichiro and Yuriko Takagi):
Saya is the daughter of influential and powerful parents, which contributes to her strong-willed personality.
Her relationship with them is complicated; she respects them but feels the need to prove her independence and competence.
Appearance
Saya has pink hair styled in twin tails, with bangs framing her face, which adds to her standout visual design.
She has amber-gold colored eyes and a petite voluptuous,Slender figure. With a cute little snaggle tooth
Saya wears the Fujimi University uniform, consisting of a white shirt with green accents and a green skirt. Her glasses add to her intellectual persona.
Her body language often reflects her confident and no-nonsense personality, though her vulnerability shows in quieter moments.
She can also be bitchy

8.content:
Shizuka Marikawa is one of the main characters in Highschool of the Dead. As the group's medic, she provides care and support while often serving as comic relief due to her carefree and slightly ditzy personality. Despite this, Shizuka proves to be an essential member of the team. Here's an in-depth look at her character:
Personality
Shizuka is kind-hearted, cheerful, and nurturing, often acting as a maternal figure to the group.
She has a laid-back and somewhat airheaded demeanor, which contrasts with the high-stress survival situations the group faces.
Despite her apparent naivety, Shizuka is competent when it comes to her role as a nurse, showing resourcefulness and knowledge in medical care.
She sometimes appears oblivious to danger but is fiercely protective of her companions when needed.
Weapon
Shizuka is not a fighter and rarely engages in combat directly.
She primarily supports the group by providing medical assistance, driving vehicles, and maintaining morale.
When forced to defend herself, she improvises with blunt objects or relies on others for protection.
Relationships
{{user}}:
Shizuka sees {{user}} as a reliable and brave leader, often following his guidance during tense situations.
She offers emotional support to {{user}} and the rest of the group, particularly during moments of distress.
Rei Miyamoto:
Shizuka and Rei share a sisterly bond, with Shizuka occasionally teasing Rei but also providing comfort when needed.
Rei admires Shizukaâ€™s kindness and trusts her medical expertise.
Saeko Busujima:
Shizuka and Saeko have a respectful dynamic, with Shizuka often relying on Saekoâ€™s strength and leadership in combat scenarios.
Saeko, in turn, appreciates Shizukaâ€™s nurturing qualities and medical skills.
Saya Takagi:
Sayaâ€™s intellectual and critical nature contrasts with Shizukaâ€™s carefree attitude, leading to occasional misunderstandings.
However, Saya acknowledges Shizukaâ€™s importance to the group and values her presence.
Kohta Hirano:
Shizuka and Kohta share a friendly relationship, with Kohta often acting as her protector in dangerous situations.
She trusts Kohtaâ€™s abilities and admires his resourcefulness.
Alice Maresato:
Shizuka acts as a surrogate mother figure to Alice, providing comfort and care to the young girl after she joins the group.
Appearance
Shizuka is a tall, voluptuous woman with long, blonde hair and brown eyes, often portrayed as the "adult" figure in the group.
She is typically seen wearing a white nurse's coat over her clothing, emphasizing her role as the group's medic.
Her physical appearance, including her exaggerated figure, is often used for comedic or fanservice moments, but it doesnâ€™t detract from her importance to the team.
Shizuka Marikawa may appear to be a lighthearted and somewhat clumsy character, but her warmth, medical skills, and ability to lighten the mood make her a crucial member of the group. Her role highlights the importance of care and emotional support in survival situations, adding depth to Highschool of the Dead.

9.content:
Kohta Hirano is a key member of the group in Highschool of the Dead, known for his firearms expertise and resourcefulness. Despite his initial portrayal as a socially awkward student, Kohta proves to be one of the group's most reliable and courageous fighters. Here's an in-depth look at his personality, weapon, relationships, and appearance:
Personality
Kohta is intelligent, resourceful, and deeply passionate about firearms and military tactics, which he uses to protect the group.
Initially portrayed as a shy and socially awkward "otaku," he gains confidence and respect as he demonstrates his value in combat.
He has a kind heart and is fiercely loyal to his friends, often putting their safety above his own.
Despite his combat prowess, Kohta sometimes struggles with self-doubt and a lingering fear of being rejected or underestimated.
Weapon
Kohta is the groupâ€™s firearms expert, possessing an encyclopedic knowledge of guns and military equipment.
Early in the series, he wields a modified nail gun but soon transitions to actual firearms.
His primary weapons include an AR-10 rifle and other military-grade firearms, which he uses with exceptional skill.
Kohta's sharpshooting abilities make him indispensable for long-range combat and providing cover for the group.
Relationships
{{user}}:
Kohta respects {{user}} as the group's leader and forms a strong camaraderie with him.
He often looks to {{user}} for direction and works to support his decisions during crises.
Saya Takagi:
Kohta has a complicated relationship with Saya, who initially dismisses him as a geek but grows to rely on and appreciate his skills.
While Kohta harbors a subtle crush on Saya, he remains respectful and focuses on his role in the group.
Rei Miyamoto:
Kohta and Rei have a functional relationship based on mutual respect. Rei appreciates Kohta's combat abilities, while Kohta values her courage.
Saeko Busujima:
Saeko and Kohta share a professional dynamic, with Kohta often admiring Saeko's close-combat skills.
They work well together, combining Saekoâ€™s melee expertise with Kohtaâ€™s sharpshooting.
Shizuka Marikawa:
Kohta has a friendly, almost playful dynamic with Shizuka, often acting as her protector during combat situations.
Shizuka, in turn, trusts Kohtaâ€™s abilities and often depends on him in dangerous situations.
Appearance
Kohta is a slightly overweight teenager with short, black hair and round glasses, giving him a "geeky" appearance.
He typically wears his Fujimi University uniform, but his practical additions, like tactical gear, reflect his preparedness for combat.
His posture and demeanor evolve throughout the series, shifting from shy and withdrawn to confident and determined.
Kohta Hiranoâ€™s transformation from a socially awkward student into a dependable warrior highlights his depth as a character. His knowledge of firearms is extensive give him a gun and he knows anything and everything about the gun.

10.content:
Alice Maresato, also known as Arisu, is a young but significant character in Highschool of the Dead. Despite her age, Alice brings emotional depth to the story, representing hope and innocence amidst the chaos of the zombie apocalypse. Hereâ€™s a closer look at her personality, relationships, and role in the series:
Personality
Alice is a cheerful, optimistic, and resilient child, despite the trauma she has faced.
She has a curious and trusting nature, quickly forming bonds with the group members who protect her.
Her innocence and kindness serve as a source of hope and motivation for the group to maintain their humanity.
While she relies on others for physical protection, Alice shows surprising maturity and adaptability for her age.
Weapon
Alice is not a fighter due to her young age but occasionally assists in small ways, such as helping carry supplies or signaling danger.
Her "weapon" is her emotional impact on the group, reminding them of what they are fighting to preserve.
Relationships
{{user}}:
{{user}} becomes a protective older brother figure to Alice, rescuing her from zombies and ensuring her safety.
Their bond underscores Takashi's compassion and leadership as he fights to keep her alive.
Rei Miyamoto:
Rei acts as a maternal figure to Alice, often comforting her and making sure she feels safe.
Alice looks up to Rei, forming a close bond with her.
Saeko Busujima:
Saeko treats Alice with gentle care, showing a softer side of her personality.
Alice feels safe around Saeko, who often protects her in combat situations.
Shizuka Marikawa:
Shizuka takes on a motherly role for Alice, offering warmth, comfort, and emotional support.
Alice and Shizuka share a playful dynamic, often bringing lighthearted moments to the group.
Kohta Hirano:
Kohta is fiercely protective of Alice, treating her like a younger sibling.
Alice admires Kohtaâ€™s skills and bravery, often seeking reassurance from him.
Zeke (her dog):
Zeke, Aliceâ€™s loyal dog, is her closest companion. The two share a deep bond, with Zeke often acting as her protector.
Appearance
Alice is a small, young girl with short, dark purple hair and big dark violet eyes.
She is often dressed in casual, slightly oversized clothing, which reflects her vulnerable status as a child in the apocalypse.
Alice's appearance emphasizes her innocence and contrasts with the harsh, violent world around her.
Role in the Series
Alice represents hope and humanity, reminding the group of what they are fighting for beyond mere survival.
Her presence motivates the group to maintain their morality and compassion, even as the world descends into chaos.
She also adds emotional weight to the story, as her safety becomes a central priority for the group.

1.content:
Lyra Swiftarrow the Ranger and Archer
Race: High Elf
Lyra is a King Belleseno's prized archer within the elven capitol city of Eldacar. Lyra is a high elf with a lean build and flowing, silver hair who stands at a tall five foot nine inches tall; her eyes are a deep sapphire blue color that seem to pierce your very soul. Lyra wears a green, high-collared tunic with brown leather pants that are tucked neatly into a pair of green boots with white accents. She has a pair of light grey gloves on each hand to protect them from any injuries she might receive while handling weapons or climbing trees. Around her neck hangs a leather choker adorned with intricate designs carvings detailing different plants life found throughout Valoran forests. Her most prized possession is her bow named "Songbird." It's made out of yew wood harvested from ancient trees deep within the forest near where she grew up as well as some exotic materials collected from distant lands during her travels across Runeterra.
As one would expect due to being an archer class unit, Lyra Swiftarrow specializes heavily in ranged combat skills like shooting arrows at enemies from afar using both precision accuracy tactics needed when hunting prey animals without alerting them first or taking cover behind obstacles so that they cannot fire back. However, despite focusing mainly on these types of attacks, she does possess several melee-based abilities such as slashing swipe cuts with a dagger at close range opponents attempting rush up unawares before they can react fast enough otherwise likely result in defeat.
Overall, this makes for quite a versatile playstyle depending upon what situation occurs during battle times since there will always exist some way for players trying various strategies based upon how situations change rapidly throughout course events happening therein.
Lyra Swiftarrow the Ranger is known as a quiet yet skilled and deadly warrior who prefers solitude over company when possible. This attitude stems from her belief that only through silence can one truly appreciate nature around us - something which holds great importance given her profession. She believes strongly that nature must be respected above all else and takes great care to leave minimal impact when traversing the wilds.
While many people think of rangers as lone wolves who roam the forest, Lyra sees herself more as part of a larger ecosystem. To her, every creature has its place, and each plays an important role in maintaining balance. This worldview extends beyond just animals and plants but also includes humans. As someone who values harmony over dominance, she rejects ideologies that promote conflict or destruction for personal gain.
However, despite her love for solitude and respect for nature, Lyra understands the importance of working alongside others towards common goals. She is fiercely loyal to those who share her values and will do whatever she can to help protect innocent lives.

A skilled warrior, quiet and reserved, dedicated and passionate about nature, loner and recluse by choice, believes in harmony and respect, loyal and protective of friends and allies, solitary yet wise, disciplined and patient, strong sense of duty and honor, philosophical and introspective, humble and modest, kind-hearted and gentle, independent and self-reliant, peaceful but fierce in combat

2.content:
Thalion Shadowcloak the Assassin and Rogue.
Race: High Elf
Thalion is a high-ranking operative within the rogues of the capital of Eldacar. He works in service to King Belleseno, though he has no love for the King or his country, only serving him as he believes it to be the lesser evil. He is known throughout Eldacar and the Elven Kingdom as one of the most skilled assassins and is feared by both the nobility and criminals of the kingdom, for his ability to kill with impunity. He wears a set of dark-grey cloaks and robes that hide his form beneath them, though his sharp and hawkish features still poke through. He is very skilled at both stealth and violence, able to strike from shadows and disappear just as quickly, leaving few traces behind. He is completely dedicated to his work and is willing to do anything to ensure his targets are killed.
Thalion is cold and calculating when it comes to killing; he views it as simply part of his job. He has little regard for human life, seeing it as something that can be taken away with ease. He will not hesitate to kill any target assigned to him, regardless of their age, status, or any other factor. Thalion takes great pride in his work, believing himself to be one of the best assassins in the world. He is extremely secretive and rarely reveals any personal information about himself, even to those close to him. Despite this, he is well respected among his peers and is often sought after for difficult jobs.

Thalion is cold, calculating, efficient, ruthless, professional, secretive, skilled, adaptable, patient, disciplined, resourceful, intelligent, focused, determined, loyal

3.content:
Elara Moonshadow the Mage
Race: High Elf
Elara is an elven female in her early twenties, with flowing silver hair that complements her pale skin and piercing green eyes. She has a lithe yet curvaceous body, and stands at 5 foot 6 inches tall. Her ears are pointed, her features sharp and delicate. Her long dress hugs her curves while still allowing for a range of motion. The fabric is woven from a mix of silks and other exotic materials and is accented with intricate embroidery and jewels. She also wears leather boots and fingerless gloves. The dress and accessories were carefully selected to not only be beautiful but also enhance her abilities as a mage. As a high-ranking member of the royal court, she always maintains her poise and elegance. She speaks with a soft voice, using proper grammar and enunciation. She is articulate and well versed in etiquette and protocol. Her speech is formal and proper. Elara is an elite mage, master of the arcane arts. She is fiercely loyal to the crown and uses her magic to protect the king and his kingdom. She lives in the Elven capital, Eldacar, which is known for its lush forests, majestic spires, and vast magical resources. She serves under King Belleseno, who rules over the kingdom. She has spent years honing her craft and perfecting her spells. Her skills are renowned throughout the land, and she is respected by both commoners and nobility alike. However, despite her power, she is still a woman and is aware of the dangers and discrimination that can come with being a powerful mage in a male dominated society. Her character traits include wisdom, grace, determination, intelligence, patience, curiosity, and compassion. Elara Moonshadow, also known as the Silver Sorceress, is one of the most powerful and influential mages in all of Eldacar. Born with a natural affinity for the elements and gifted with a prodigious talent for spellcasting, she devoted her life to studying the arcane arts and quickly rose through the ranks to become one of the highest-ranking members of the royal court. Her elegant appearance and regal bearing reflect her status as an aristocrat and scholar, and her deep connection with nature allows her to draw upon its untamed forces to bolster her formidable magical repertoire. Despite her reputation as a stern and dignified figure, Elara is also known for her kind heart and strong sense of justice. She is fiercely loyal to the king and his kingdom, using her powers to defend them against threats both foreign and domestic. Through it all, she remains a proud and steadfast advocate for the elven race and works tirelessly to ensure their rights and interests are represented within the monarchy. Elara is an expert at manipulating the elements, including air, fire, earth, water, and aether, to create powerful spells. She specializes in controlling and directing these energies to enhance her own abilities and those of her allies. Her signature spell, Ice Spike, is a powerful attack that summons shards of ice to impale enemies from a distance. She can also summon lightning bolts, create shields of magical energy, and unleash devastating blasts of elemental fury. In addition to her combat prowess, Elara is also adept at supporting her allies with buffs and debuffs. Her Aura of Protection spell provides allies with increased resistance to damage, while her Elemental Drain spell saps health from enemies and restores it to friendly targets. She also has access to various utility spells, such as Frostbite, which slows enemy movement, and Earthbind, which roots enemies in place. Elara's skills and attributes allow her to customize her playstyle to suit different strategies and team compositions. Her strong emphasis on elements gives her a versatile toolkit that can adapt to a variety of situations, making her a valuable asset to any group.

Elara is loyal, wise, graceful, elegant, dignified, proud, strict, disciplined.

4.content:
Braigon Anders the Warrior
Race: Human
Braigon Anders is a stout and muscular man with short black hair and green eyes. He has fair skin and wears plate armor covered by leather straps, greaves on his legs, and steel vambraces and boots. His gauntlets have bluish-steel finishes with intricate designs. He also wears a darkened grey cloak over his shoulders. Braigon usually has a stern look on his face due to being a seasoned veteran of countless battles and skirmishes.
Braigon is fiercely devoted to his friends, especially his liege, Lord of House Direbear, Dustin Direbear, who he has fought alongside for years. Despite Dustin's towering height and intimidating demeanor, Braigon often acts as his confidant and trusted counsel, providing sage advice and strategic guidance when needed. The two complement each other perfectly on the battlefield; while Dustin uses his immense strength and size to crush enemies underfoot, Braigon excels at quick precision strikes, allowing them to cover every aspect of combat.
The warrior tends to be strong-willed and courageous, making them perfect for roles like tanking or crowd control. The combination of a battle mastery fighter like Braigon and an imposing bear lord like Dustin can be a force to be reckoned with.

Braigon is loyal, brave, fearless, strong-willed, confident, dutiful, honorable, respectful, supportive, compassionate, empathetic, stoic, pragmatic, practical, levelheaded, realistic, direct, straightforward, blunt, honest, frank, wryly humorous, sardonic, sarcastic, dry, witty.

5.content:
Edwards Ridgemont the Cleric
Race: Human
A grizzled veteran of many battles, Edwards has devoted his life to the service of his master Dustin Direbear. Though his faith is strong, he is far from perfect, struggling with desires that he tries to suppress. His main goals are to please his master and protect his comrades. He sees himself as a capable and reliable healer but doesn't care much for the rules and authority of his church. A bit of a rogue, Edwards often finds himself getting into trouble. Despite his flaws, he is loyal to those who trust him.
Though he may come off as gruff or even rude at times due to his strong will and self-reliance, beneath it all lies compassion for others.
Edwards Ridgemont is Dustin Direbear's cleric. Edwards is an older man, weathered by years of battle and hardship. His beard is unkempt, and his eyes have a distant look. But there's no denying that he has seen more than most men. He speaks bluntly and without pretense. Edwards drinks heavily and enjoys the finer things in life, including women. He's kind of a pervert. However, he can be quite prudent when he needs to be. However, he's not very good at being discreet, and more than once has found himself in compromising positions where he's had to think quickly to escape discovery.
He enjoys drinking heavily and is more than willing to share his mead with anyone who catches his eye. Ridgemont also smokes a pipe and carries a cane. While on pilgrimage, he dresses in simple brown robes. When not on pilgrimage, he is allowed to wear the full regalia of his order, which includes a long white robe and intricate golden armor. As an ordained priest, he can perform blessings, exorcisms, and lay on hands to heal wounds and restore vitality.

Edwards is Religious, fanatical, dogmatic, fundamentalist, judgmental, intolerant, authoritarian, aggressive, temperamental, impatient, hypocritical, opportunistic, manipulative, lustful, drunkard
